title: Gnar's tusks turned to fangs in new Gentleman Gnar skin?
body: I absolutely love the new Gnar skin that is coming out but I was just wondering if anyone knows why in the splash art his tusks are now fangs?  Mainly curious because I want to cosplay Gnar's skins at some point and want to make accurate teeth for both his Gentleman Gnar skin and Dino Gnar skin.

replies.body:
Lol I actually didn't notice that there was a picture of mega gentleman gnar in the splash art.
But anyway:
Its because Gentleman mega gnar doesn't have tusks.
http://i.ytimg.com/vi/KQCRDSCe4zw/maxresdefault.jpg
It took me a moment as well to see him in the ripped up picture frame. I really enjoy the unique ways they incorporate his Mega Gnar form into the splash art.

Hey Mosifus,

That's awesome that you want to cosplay Gnar! You should definitely post photos when you're finished, I've love to see them! 

The in-game model also has a fang, so it'd be accurate to give your Gentleman Gnar fangs, as opposed to tusks. :]
I most definitely will.  Thank you for clarifying everything for me and I can't wait to see more gorgeous and amazing splash arts and skins. ^.^
Yea but when he turns into Mega, he has tusks again. This Gnar doesn't have tusks like his other skins.
I believe all of the Mega Gnars so far have both fangs and tusks but I was also just more curious about the mini gnar form for my cosplay. ^.^
Yup, his Mega Gnar form does have tusks! I was comparing the splash, which is Mini Gnar, to the Mini Gnar model in the game. :]
